title: How to make perfect pastry pies (even when they're the size of your palm)
text:
Pies are both fantastical and everyday. I follow several pie makers on Instagram – Julie Jones and Karin Pfeiff Boschek, to name two – just so I can marvel at their ability to fashion pastry into bouquets and leafy trellises. And I can never forget the picture in my nursery-rhyme book where four-and-twenty blackbirds flew out of a pie and sang as they swooped towards the maid.

More often, though – and I like these just as much – pies are vehicles for using up leftovers; the turkey and ham at Christmas, the nuggets of meat bound with a nutmeggy bechamel, for example. They can still be prettily decorated, but the point of these pies is comfort and frugality.
